International Restrictions:
*Entry rules in response to coronavirus (COVID-19): The Fiji government has announced changes to international travel due to Covid-19. Whether entry will be permitted to Fiji and what the process is on arrival will depend on individual circumstances but the major consideration is the countries you have visited or transited in the fourteen days prior to entering Fiji. Fiji has placed all countries into one of three categories: “Travel Partner” countries, which includes the UK ; “Non-Travel Partner” countries; and “Red-List” countries. Full information on the latest rules is available from the Ministry of Commerce, Trade, Tourism and Transport and you should familiarise yourself carefully with these. In some cases approval prior to travel must be sought.
A pre-departure COVID-19 test is required for all travel to Fiji. The type of test required and the time limit it can be taken before you travel depends on a number of factors including your country of origin, travel route and age. You should familiarise yourself carefully with the latest rules.
Only fully vaccinated travellers are able to enter Fiji and the vaccine must be of a type approved by the Fijian authorities. You will also need to ensure you meet testing and vaccination requirements of your airline and any countries transited on route to Fiji. The Government of Fiji requires travellers coming for tourist purposes to have medical travel insurance that covers COVID-19.
You may transit Nadi Airport from Travel Partner countries if you have a valid ticket, negative COVID-19 test and are fully vaccinated. All foreign nationals who are currently unable to leave Fiji have been advised to contact Fiji Immigration Office so that they may be properly guided to maintain their legal status. This applies to all categories of permit holders.
These restrictions supersede the regular entry requirements set out below which refer to Fiji’s requirements that existed before the border was closed.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Fiji: Some travel restrictions are in place in Fiji. Ensure you check the latest rules carefully when making travel plans. Mask wearing is mandatory in all public places including public transport and people can be fined for non-compliance. More information on the latest restrictions are available on the Fiji government website.
*Accommodation: Some hotels and rental accommodation are open with COVID-19 protocols in place. You may be asked for proof of vaccination against COVID-19 when checking-in and may be turned away if you don’t have this.
*Public places and services: Following the lifting of the majority of COVID-19 restrictions in October 2021, many businesses and public places have reopened. Everyone is required to follow COVID-19 safety protocols, including on mask wearing and social distancing. The Government of Fiji has introduced regulations that require all workers in both the public and private sector to obtain a COVID-19 vaccination. Although formal requirements to check proof of vaccination have now eased you may be asked for proof of vaccination when entering businesses, including restaurants, bars and hotels.
